intro: Banara guianensis var. spruceana, commonly known as the Guianan banara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela, Guyana, and Suriname. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
